page.title: 15Health, local hospital.
page.content: The Brampton Memorial Hospital is a small cottage hospital which serves Brampton and the neighbouring parishes. Very occasionally, in emergency, a patient from Carlisle is admitted. The hospital was built after the first world war with money raised by the local people and maintained by them until 1948 when it was taken over by the National Healt Service. A nursing officer, one of a community team, is in charge of the hospital. Throughout the 24 hours of the day, a trained nurse and an auxiliary are on duty. A physiotherapist visits daily. There is a cook and some domestic staff. Voluntary helpers come daily and the League of Friends help with transport of day patients visiting, providing and arranging flowers and doing patients shopping.
